revised_title: Magneto-Electric Induction in Liquids and Gases: Production of Induced Currents in Electrolytes
tldr: The author investigates the production of induced currents in liquids through magneto-electric induction, examining three cases: a liquid stream flowing in a constant magnetic field, a liquid rotating over a magnetic pole, and a liquid at rest in a variable magnetic field. The study provides insights into the behavior of induced currents in electrolytes and their potential impact on ocean currents and isogonic lines.
